channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to know about the mass Gen Z protests in Nepal
item.description: At least 19 people have been killed in the protests and more than 200 others were admitted to the hospital due to injuries, according to Nepal's Civil Service Hospital.
item.content:encoded:
At least 19 people have been killed in the protests and more than 200 others were admitted to the hospital due to injuries, according to Nepal's Civil Service Hospital.

(Image credit: Ambir Tolang)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Hollywood stars boycott Israeli film companies in response to Gaza crisis
item.description: Emma Stone, Ava DuVernay and Gael Garcia Bernal are among more than 2,000 who signed the petition.
item.content:encoded:
Emma Stone, Ava DuVernay and Gael Garcia Bernal are among more than 2,000 who signed the petition.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear challenge to some of Trump's sweeping tariffs
item.description: The tariffs have become a flashpoint, with two lower courts declaring them illegal, and the president asking the Supreme Court for reversal as soon as possible.
item.content:encoded:
The tariffs have become a flashpoint, with two lower courts declaring them illegal, and the president asking the Supreme Court for reversal as soon as possible.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Supreme Court will weigh in on Trump's tariffs. Here's what to know about the case
item.description: Two lower courts have said some of President Trump's tariffs are unlawful. Now the Supreme Court has agreed to examine the issue.
item.content:encoded:
Two lower courts have said some of President Trump's tariffs are unlawful. Now the Supreme Court has agreed to examine the issue.

(Image credit: Frederic J. Brown)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Iran and nuclear watchdog sign agreement seeking path to restart cooperation
item.description: Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency signed an agreement in Cairo to pave the way for resuming cooperation, including on ways of relaunching inspections of Iran's nuclear facilities.
item.content:encoded:
Iran and the International Atomic Energy Agency signed an agreement in Cairo to pave the way for resuming cooperation, including on ways of relaunching inspections of Iran's nuclear facilities.

(Image credit: Khaled Elfiqi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The MAHA plan for healthier kids includes 128 ideas, but few details
item.description: The Make America Healthy Again commission is proposing more than 100 moves to address the root causes of childhood chronic disease. Critics say other Trump administration moves contradict the goals.
item.content:encoded:
The Make America Healthy Again commission is proposing more than 100 moves to address the root causes of childhood chronic disease. Critics say other Trump administration moves contradict the goals.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: 60 years later, Sandy Koufax's perfect game is still amazing
item.description: Tuesday marks 60 years since Sandy Koufax threw a perfect game at Dodger Stadium. The 1-0 victory over the Chicago Cubs is still considered one of the best games in baseball history.
item.content:encoded:
Tuesday marks 60 years since Sandy Koufax threw a perfect game at Dodger Stadium. The 1-0 victory over the Chicago Cubs is still considered one of the best games in baseball history.

(Image credit: Harold P. Matosian)
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Ethiopia inaugurates Africa's biggest dam amid regional tensions
item.description: Ethiopia opens Africa's largest hydropower project, the Blue Nile's Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam — a milestone that's sparking alarm in neighboring Sudan and Egypt.
item.content:encoded:
Ethiopia opens Africa's largest hydropower project, the Blue Nile's Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam — a milestone that's sparking alarm in neighboring Sudan and Egypt.

(Image credit: Brian Inganga)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Michigan judge dismisses charges against 15 pro-Trump 'fake electors'
item.description: A Michigan judge has dismissed criminal charges against 15 people who signed false certificates saying Donald Trump won the state's electoral votes in 2020.
item.content:encoded:
A Michigan judge has dismissed criminal charges against 15 people who signed false certificates saying Donald Trump won the state's electoral votes in 2020.

(Image credit: Paul Sancya)
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Swasey

item.title: 'The Office' creators deliver 'The Paper,' a sharp mockumentary about journalism
item.description: The issues facing journalism these days — from online clickbait to corporate interference — run throughout The Paper. But it's primarily a comedy, with characters and actors that will win you over.
item.content:encoded: The issues facing journalism these days — from online clickbait to corporate interference — run throughout The Paper. But it's primarily a comedy, with characters and actors that will win you over.
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli
